conbody.p: When writing topics in LearningDITA, use these guiding principles:

ul.li: Keep things simple. Avoid convoluted sentences; avoid long and twisty discussions.
Leave completeness to the DITA specification. The goal is to introduce the basics of the subject, rather than go through an exhaustive list of what is possible.
If there are additional interesting things the reader might want to learn, point them to additional resources.
Keep things light and light-hearted. A dense block of text may scare a reader away.
Use lots of ducks. Be creative!
